page.title: 03HEALTH CARE AT AWRE
page.content: HEALTH CARE AT AWRE IS SHARED BETWEEN DR DUKES AT NEWNHAM AND DR HOLLAND AT BLAKENEY. WE INTERVIEWED DR HOLLAND IN HIS SURGERY,WHICH USED TO BE BLAKENEY POST OFFICE. THERE IS NO SURGERY AT AWRE AND HIS PATIENTS THERE TRAVEL TWO MILES TO SEE HIM. HE RARELY GETS CALLED OUT AT NIGHT;SUCH CALLS ARE MOSTLY FROM MOTHERS WORRIED ABOUT THEIR CHILDREN,AND THERE ARE AT PRESENT NO INFANTS IN AWRE. HE DESCRIBED HIS PATIENTS AT AWRE AS HEALTHY FARMING STOCK WITH FEW SPECIAL HEALTH PROBLEMS. WE ASKED HIM IF THE NUCLEAR STATION AT BERKELEY HAD CAUSED HEALTH PROBLEMS AT AWRE. HE ANSWERED THAT NEARBY HAD BEEN 5 CASES OF CHILD LEUKEMIA BUT NONE IN AWRE;IN HIS PRACTICE WAS AN INCREASED INCIDENT OF CANCER OF THE BOWEL. IT WOULD TAKE ANOTHER TWENTY YEARS TO SEE THE FULL EFFECTS OF THE NUCLEAR STATIONS.
